bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, March 19, 1941

div1.p: Hench comments on the Lazear story in "True Comics." Hench also discusses his travel plans in Cuba and his presentation to the Cuban Minister of Defense.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, March 19, 1941
div1.opener:
Personal
March 19, 1941
Mr. Ralph Hutchison
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
Dear Hutch:
div1.p:
I am delighted that you liked the “True Comics.” I bought 30 copies
and sent various people interested in the yellow fever copies of it. Mary
and I were so sorry that you could not come out for your annual visit and
examination. We are all leaving Friday with the children, Rose, our maid,
for Florida. Our address will be the Villa Atlantique Hotel, Palm Beach
and we will be there about a month. I plan to run over to Havana alone for
a week about March 28th. I have just completed a formal report to His
Excellency, Dr. Domingo F. Ramos, Minister of Defense on the location of
Camp Lazear and supplemented our report with maps and photographs. It has
been quite a job but an interesting one. I will try on my return to make
up an extra copy and at least send it to you for your perusal. If I learn
anything exciting in Havana, I will certainly drop you a line and I do
hope that you can visit Palm Beach with us some time. Don't let the
address Palm Beach scare you because this is a very nice little hotel
owned by Mary's cousin and we could get you wonderful rates for any Easter
vacation or earlier for yourself and family.
div1.closer: Always sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:FP
